New Records: Kerry Carpenter's pinch-hit single was a crucial part of the Tigers' comeback win.
Key Match Events: Justyn-Henry Malloy's eighth-inning sacrifice fly helped the Tigers rally from a 3-0 deficit.
Colt Keith tied the game with an RBI single.
Beau Brieske got the win with two innings of relief.
Jason Foley pitched the ninth for his 27th save.
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers entered the game tied with Kansas City for the second and third American League wildcard spots, two games ahead of the Minnesota Twins.
Post-Match Reflections: The win moved the Tigers closer to the postseason.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers won five straight games leading up to this match.
Others: Rays starter Tyler Alexander allowed four hits and struck out six without walking a batter.
Kevin Kelly pitched a perfect seventh, extending his scoreless streak to 23 1/3 innings over 25 outings.
